entry.title: dsi introduction
entry.content:
DSI Introduction

MIPI_DSI_Specification_V1.02.00

1 MIPI DSI

  • Display Serial InterfaceMIPIDPI(Display Pixel Interface)DBI(Display Bus Interface)DCS(Display Command Set

  • MIPI-DSI1~4(DATA Lane 0)D-PHYblog

2 DSI

  • DSID-PHYD-PHY

2.1 PHY-Layer:blog

2.2 Lane Management

  • MasterLaneSlaveData Lane

2.3 Low Level Protocol

  • MasterSlave

  • (long packet)(short packet),ECCCRCECCCRC

  • (short packet)

      • byte3Data Identifier (DI)0-5bit()6-7bit
      • byte1-2Packet DataData0Data1Data10
      • byte0ECC

  • (long packet)

    • 4+(065535)+2 = 665541bytes
    • DIWordCountChecksumECC
    • 2bytes

2.4 Application

  • MIPI-DSIMasterSlave

3 Command Mode and Video Mode

  • command modemipivideo mode
    • command modeTE pin
    • video modev-synch-syncpanel
  • Command Modeframebuffercommand Mode
  • video modeHS Modevideo modeframebuffervideo mode

4

  • DSI clockhost
    • DSI BitClock:
    • Byte Clock
    • Application ClockDSI
  • dsi clk = Bitclk / 2 = H-total x V-total x fps x / lane number / 2
    • H-total HSYNCHBPHFP
    • V-total: VSYNCVBPVFP
    • /2MIPI
    • fps
    • rgb888-24 rgb565-16

5

  • Transmisspacketmultiple packetsHS modeLPS(Low-Power State)Separate transmissionSingle TransmissionTransmissionpackets

  • DSI short packetEoTp-end of transmission packet,packetdisableenableSpecification

6 video mode

  • video mode
  • video(packet)
    packetdescription
    VSSDSI Sync Event Packet: V Sync Start
    VSEDSI Sync Event Packet: V Sync End
    BLLPDSI Packet: Arbitrary sequence of non-restricted DSI packets or Low Power Mode incluing optional BTA
    HSSDSI Sync Event Packet: H Sync Start
    HASDSI Blanking Packet: Horizontal Sync Active or Low Power Mode, No Data
    HSEDSI Sync Event Packet: H Sync End
    HFPDSI Blanking Packet: Horizontal Front Porch or Low Power Mode
    HBPDSI Blanking Packet: Horizontal Back Porch or Low Power Mode
    RGBDSI Packet: Arbitrary sequence of pixel stream and Null Packets
    LPMLow Power Mode incuding optional BTA

6.1 Non-Burst Mode with Sync Pulses

  • DSIDPIDPI

    • HSA (Horizontal Sync Active)
    • HBP (Horizontal Back Porch)
    • HFP (Horizontal Front Porch)
    • LaneLP-11

6.2 Non-Burst Mode with Sync Events

  • Non-Burst Mode with Sync Pulses

6.3 Burst mode()

  • horizontal DSIPanelRGB

6.4


6.5

  • VSA Lines VBP Lines VFP LinesActive Video AreaRGB

Packet Data Types

entry.title: MIPI D-PHY
entry.content:
MIPI D-PHY

1 MIPI D-PHY

1.1 MIPI

  • MIPI - Mobile Industry Processor Interface

  • MIPI

    • PHY LAYER D-PHY
    • low level protocollane management
    • application

1.2 D-PHY

  • DSI - Display Serial Interface ()

  • D-PHYDSI (CSID-PHY)

    • MIPImasterslaveclock laneslavedata lane

    • D-PHY one clock Lane and one or more Data Lane

    • Clock Lane()Data Lane

    • lane types

      • Clock Lane
      • Data Lane
      • Data Lane

      • low power(CTRL)
      • high speed(DATA)

    • HSLP

      HSLP
      80M-1.5Gbps<10Mbps

  • 1 byte (LSB first)

2 Lane Module

  • lane

    • PHYD-PHY D-PHYLane Module
    • D-PHY
      • LP-TX
      • LP-RX
      • HS-TX
      • HS-RX
      • LP-CD(low power contention detector)
    • DpDnlane
    • DSIDATA0LPHSDATA LANELPHS

  • Lane Module

    • Clock Lane
      • Master: HS-TX LP-TX
      • Slave: HS-RX LP-RX
    • Data Lane
      • Master: HS-TX LP-TX
      • Slave: HS-RX LP-RX
    • Data Lane
      • Master/Slave: HS-TX HS-RX LP-RX LP-TX LP-CD

3 lane states and line level(Dp and Dn)

  • DpDnHS0/1LP00/01/10/11

  • lane stateline level

    • note 1: LP receiverLP-00
    • note 2escape modeLP-11, lane module(control mode LP-11)

4 Data Lane

  • data lane Control ModeHigh-Speed(Data Burst) ModeEscape Mode
  • control modestop state
    • Escape Mode Requset: (LP-11LP-10LP-00LP-01LP-00)
    • High-Speed Request: (LP-11LP-01LP-00)
    • Turnaround Request: (LP-11LP-10LP-00LP-10LP-00)

4.1 Escape Mode

  • Escape Mode Data Lane LP

  • Escape Mode

    • LPDT (Low-Power Data Transmission)
    • ULPS (Ultra Low-Power State)
    • Trigger

  • Escape Mode8 bitentry command

  • escape mode

  • Escape Mode Data LaneClock LaneDpDn

  • Escape Mode Spaced-One-Hot Encoding

    • Space State(LP-00)()
    • Space StateMark-0/10-bit 1-bit

  • Data LaneEscape ModeLP-10LP-11

  • Entry Commandcodestatetrigger

  • state trigger

    • Remote Triggersreset trigger:If the Entry Command Pattern matches the Reset-Trigger Command a Trigger is flagged to the protocol at the receive side via the logical PPI. Any bit received after a Trigger Command but before the Lines go to Stop state shall be ignored. Therefore, dummy bytes can be concatenated in order to provide Clock information to the receive side.

    • Low-Power Data Transmission(LPDT):

      • Spaced-One-Hot Encoding
      • Clock Lane
      • Space State

    • Ultra Low-Power State

      • ULPSDpDnSpace state(LP-00)
      • ULPST(wakeup)=1msMark-1,Stop state

4.2 High-Speed Mode(Data Burst)

  • Lane

  • Lane

  • Clock LaneHigh-Speed ModeSlave side DDR

    • LP-Control
    • HS-Data Burst

4.3 Bi-directional Data Lane Turnaround

  • Turnaround Procedure

  • MasterSlave side

  • Turnaround LP-Control Mode

  • Tunraround


  • Turnaround Procedure

5 Clock Lane

  • High-SpeedULPS Clock Lane

5.1 High-Speed Clock Transmission

  • bit

  • Data Burst bit

  • High-Speed Clock TransmissionLP Mode

  • Data LaneHS Data TransmissionHS-0LP ModeT(CLK-POST)Clock LaneHigh-Speed Clock TransmissionLP ModeLP Mode High-Speed Clock Transmission

    1. Stop state (LP-11)

    3. TX-ULPS State (LP-00)
    4. Ultra-Low Power StateTX-ULPS State (LP-00)
